description: Today's economic indicators could be a positive sign for end-of-year growth.
title: Consumer spending and personal income rise in August
teaser: Today's economic indicators could be a positive sign for end-of-year growth.
contenttemplated:
[{"content":"

U.S. households spent .3 percent more in August than they did in the previous month according to new figures out today. In more positive news, incomes rose .4 percent in August, the biggest month-to-month gain since February. Chris Low, chief economist at FTN Financial, calls this is a pleasant surprise.

","type":"text/html"}]
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, September 27, 2013
contentencoded: U.S. households spent .3 percent more in August than they did in the previous month according to new figures out today. In more positive news, incomes rose .4 percent in August, the biggest month-to-month gain since February. Chris Low, chief economist at FTN Financial, calls this is a pleasant surprise.
